headline.print_headline: A Home of Her Own  Meant Thinking Big  and Building Small
headline.main: A Tiny Home Takes Shape in Brooklyn, but It May Not Stay

snippet: In New York, the trend toward living small usually involves the micro-apartment, but one woman has joined the Tiny House Movement and is building a 160-square-foot one of her own.
abstract: The Appraisal column; New York City entrepreneur Miko Mercer has joined nation's increasingly popular movement to build and live in tiny houses, defined as dwellings offering less than 400 square feet of living space; Mercer is building 160-square-foot home inside Brooklyn warehouse, with plans to relocate outside city upon completion; hundreds of tiny house enthusiasts live in New York City, but only 10 have built such structures, all located outside five boroughs.
